IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The Monarch Institute for Neurological Differences is dedicated to empowering individuals with neurological differences to move from dependence to interdependence and make more meaningful contributions in life.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Monarch School and Institute is globally recognized and dedicated to providing an innovative, therapeutic education for individuals with neurological differences in an environment that supports self-determination and empowerment in the greater community.
IRS990.Desc: The Monarch School utilizes a unique therapeutic approach with Four Core Goals(TM) and sequential, developmental objectives in the areas of self-regulation and self-awareness, executive functions, relationship development, and academic and professional competencies. We offer safe environments where students can experience developmentally appropriate practices designed to help them progress. - CHRYSALIS supports students at the preschool, elementary, and secondary academic levels in their development. The core goals are addressed through a developmental level system. This educational approach is holistic, being both therapeutic and academic. - BUTTERFLY serves students at the middle and high school academic levels (grades 6-12). Students navigate a multi-part schedule (changing classes) interacting with a variety of students and adults throughout their day. Students engage in one of three program pathways in preparation for a 4 year or 2 year college program and/or Monarch's Transition Services. - THE LIFE ACADEMY features student operated businesses, entrepreneurial training, and internship/employment opportunities as part of Monarch's day school program. - TRANSITION SERVICES helps guide young adults toward increased capacity for employment, education, and life outside their family home. Services may include transitional, educational, employment, and living experiences with Monarch supervisory faculty in houses and apartments near our campus. Enrollment for the 2017-2018 year was approximately 113 students.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Therapy Services and Diagnostic Clinic provide unique, team based assessment, consultation, and therapeutic support services to children and adults. Also offered: DIRFloortime, Speech Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Educational Consultation, and Music Therapy. The Training Center offers workshops, seminars, and consultations for parents, teachers, administrators, and medical/mental health professionals interested in serving students with special needs.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: The Residential program provides social and emotional support, healthy lifestyles, physical movement, robust social opportunities, medication oversight, personal hygiene support, and meal planning which includes healthy choices, regular trips to the grocery store, and some transportation. Our Residential Program includes houses and apartments for young adults who benefit from assistance making the transition to greater independence. Enrollment for the 2017-2018 school year was approximately 18 students.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: The Monarch School is classified as a School under IRC Section 170(b)(1)(A(ii). As such, it is not required to complete the Schedule A Part II Support Schedule for Organizations Described in Sections 170(b)(1)(A(iv) and 170(b)(1)(A(vi). The School is voluntarily including Schedule A Part II to the Form 990. For Schedule B Schedule of Contributors, the School meets the 33 1/3% support test of the regulations under sections 509(a)(1) and 170(b)(1)(A)(vi) and is reporting under the Special Rule.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The endowment is intended to provide operating support to the school in perpetuity and, accordingly is invested with a long-term horizon.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
Part XII, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
Schedule E, Line 3 - Racially Nondiscriminatory Policy Publicized
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Annual "Notice of Nondiscriminatory Policy as to Students" is placed in the Houston Chronicle.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 4 - Explanation of Records and Materials Not Maintained
Schedule E, Line 5 - Explanation of Organization Discrimination by Race
Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Monarch School seeks to provide financial assistance to qualified students who would not otherwise be able to afford a Monarch education. Monarch uses the analysis system of Independent School Management (ISM) FAST financial aid software in determining a familys need for aid. This national service provides schools with information and guidelines for granting financial aid awards fairly and equitably on the basis of need. The School awards financial assistance annually once a signed contract has been received by applying a reduction to the total tuition cost. Families are required to re-apply each year. No additional monitoring is required once funds have been applied to the approved students' account.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule L, Part V Supplemental Information
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The School leases three housing units for the Transition Service program on a month-to-month basis from three limited liability companies, the principal member of which is a board member. The monthly rent payments are below market and cover only mortgage, insurance and minimal repair costs.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Head of School and Business Manager review the completed Form. A copy of the Form 990 is provided to the Board prior to filing with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The interested party has a duty to disclose all material facts to the board, while the board shall determine whether a conflict of interest exists. If the board has reasonable cause to believe a member has failed to disclose an actual or possible conflict of interest, it shall inform the member of the basis for the belief and afford the member the opportunity to explain the alleged failure to disclose. If the board determines failure to disclose an actual conflict of interest, it will take appropriate disciplinary and corrective action.Rentals of school facilities reported on Schedule L were approved under these procedures. The monthly rent payments are below market and cover only mortgage, insurance and minimal repair costs.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Trustees evaluates comparable data such as independent surveys and other data, which include total revenues, number of employees, industry code, tax status, and other information, in determining compensation of such individuals. The compensation arrangement of the Head of School is approved by the Board annually independent of payee.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Head of School determines all other employee salaries. Program Directors review teacher's salaries annually and award salary increases and bonuses based on performance and review.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
